definition.name: NXfit_function
definition.doc:
This describes a fit function that is used to fit data to any functional form.
A fit function is used to describe a set of data :math:`y_k, k = 1 ... M`, which are collected as a function of one or more independent variables :math:`x` at the points :math:`x_k`. The fit function :math:`f` describes these data in an approximative way as :math:`y_k \approx f(a_0, . . . a_n, x_k)`, where :math:`a_i, i = 0 . . . n` are the *fit parameters* (which are stored the instances of ``NXfit_parameter``).

field.name: description
field.doc: Human-readable description of this fit function.

field.name: formula_description
field.doc: Description of the mathematical formula of the function, taking into account the instances of ``TERM`` in ``fit_parameters``.

field.name: TERM
field.doc: A parameter for a fit function. This would typically be a variable that is optimized in a fit.

attribute.name: description
attribute.doc: A description of what this parameter represents.

attribute.name: min_value
attribute.doc: The minimal value of the parameter, to be used as a constraint during fitting.

attribute.name: max_value
attribute.doc: The maximal value of the parameter, to be used as a constraint during fitting.
